sentences.sContent: But then again, so does asparagus.
sentences.sCn: 但话又说回来，芦笋也是如此。

sentences.sContent: It is right at the drip line of the tree. So when it rains, all the rain drips down right on the asparagus.
sentences.sContent_eng: It is right at the drip line of the tree. So when it rains, all the rain drips down right on the asparagus.
sentences.sCn: 它们刚好种在大树的滴水线下，所以每当下雨的时候，所有雨滴都刚好落在芦笋上。

sentences.sContent: Memories of the first asparagus and carrots he ate from a garden years before led him to start growing produce on the roof of his landmarked brownstone in Park Slope, Brooklyn, six or seven years ago.
sentences.sContent_eng: Memories of the first asparagus and carrots he ate from a garden years before led him to start growing produce on the roof of his landmarked brownstone in Park Slope, Brooklyn, six or seven years ago.
sentences.sCn: 记忆的六，七年前第一次在菜园里吃芦笋和胡萝卜的经验，带领他开始在屋顶上种菜，他在地标式的赤褐色砂石房子位于布鲁克林区的公园斜坡 。

trans.tranOther: a long thin green vegetable with a point at one end
